column4: hi guys quick one - i've installed xubuntu onto an old PC which has on board video. my video res is set to a max of 800x600 - how can i find out my video card and increase the screen res? thanks
xrandr will list all the available rezzys
what graphic card did you say you have?
that's the problem i dont know - it's on-board and the PC is 5-6 years old
is there a command i can use to find out?
nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf, Ctrl+W and type Driver and hit enter. that will show what driver it is currently using
so much for middle clicking that link
oh, NVIDIA, eh? You can get more then that... use the nv driver, or get the driver you need from the nVidia website, they have linux drivers
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg when you get a chance (this might have to kill X)
